snippet: The estimate contradicts both classified assessments by the United States government and many outside experts.
abstract: Iranian government publishes first detailed estimates of how long it will take its scientists and engineers to assemble nuclear weapon, saying it will take years, not months, to complete; says hypothetical estimate is intended to allay fears that nation has ability to race for bomb; American officials dispute conclusions, which contradict both classified assessments and estimates by outside experts.
lead_paragraph: The estimate contradicts both classified assessments by the United States government and many outside experts.

headline.main: Building Nuclear Weapon Would Take Years, Not Months, Iran Says in Report
headline.print_headline: Building Nuclear Weapon Would Take Years, Not Months, Iran Says in Report
